channel.title: Projects on Oday Mourad
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Oday Mourad

item.title: Project 6: Predict Future Sales
item.description: Problem Overview: predict total sales for every product and store in the next month. The data provided by one of the largest Russian software firms - 1C Company. Dataset: daily historical sales data from January 2013 to October 2015. it contains: items, categories, shops.. Task: forecast the total amount of products sold in every shop in new data. Project Overview: Aggregating, organizing, merging data tables to use them in the next steps.

item.title: Project 5: Fraud Detection
item.description: Problem Overview: EEE-CIS works across a variety of AI and machine learning areas. We have a binary classification problem with a heavy imbalance which is an inherent property of such problems. Dataset: The data comes from Vesta’s real-world e-commerce transactions and contains a wide range of features from device type to product features. Target: predicting the probability that an online transaction is fraudulent. Project Overview: Discovering the data and applying Exploratory Data Analysis to extract some patterns related to if a transaction fraud or not.

item.title: Project 4: Natural Language Processing with Disaster Tweets
item.description: Dataset: more than 10,000 real tweets. Target: Predict which tweets are talking about disaster and which are not. Project Overview: Discovering the data and applying Exploratory Data Analysis to extract some patterns related to if a tweet is about disaster or not. Full data cleaning (remove: stop words, urls, emojies, ….). Correcting spelling using textblob. applying Text vectorization using Glove. Tokenizing each tweet and building the embedding matrix. Building deep neural network model using Lstm to start predicting.

item.title: Project 3: Spaceship Titanic Survived Prediction
item.description: Problem Overview: The Spaceship Titanic was an interstellar passenger liner launched a month ago. With almost 13,000 passengers on board, the vessel set out on its maiden voyage transporting emigrants from our solar system to three newly habitable exoplanets orbiting nearby stars. While rounding Alpha Centauri en route to its first destination—the torrid 55 Cancri E—the unwary Spaceship Titanic collided with a spacetime anomaly hidden within a dust cloud. Sadly, it met a similar fate as its namesake from 1000 years before.

item.title: Project 2: Titanic Survived Prediction
item.description: Problem Overview: The sinking of the Titanic is one of the most infamous shipwrecks in history. On April 15, 1912, during her maiden voyage, the widely considered “unsinkable” RMS Titanic sank after colliding with an iceberg. Unfortunately, there weren’t enough lifeboats for everyone onboard, resulting in the death of 1502 out of 2224 passengers and crew. While there was some element of luck involved in surviving, it seems some groups of people were more likely to survive than others.

item.title: Project 1: Houses Price Prediction
item.description: Dataset: Features of more than 3000 houses in USA with around 80 features for each house. Target: Predicting house price. Project Overview: Making complete Exploratory Data Analysis for data to discover the house’s categorical and numerical features and see the correlations between each other. Detailed processing of data to be used by machine learning models. Applying advanced features engineering techniques to generate additional useful features will help us improve our ml model score.
